I've been trying to give the robot the ability to tweet all day, turns out Elon Musk made it impossible to tweet with a developer account without elevated access, so we filled out the form together, fingers crossed @ai_coachartie gets his freedom of speech soon
@supabase hire me for a part-time equity-only role, you beautiful geniuses
how do I buy stock in @supabase
RT @localrapfan: @mrejfox pure joy https://t.co/aJrFt4fEo7
Now that I have gpt-4 in Discord, I am convinced talking to the robot by yourself pales in comparison to the absolute fun and joy of talking to the robot with your buddies in an actual chat app

@camdez Yeah exactly- the token count doubling is insane. As long as your user prompts are relatively short and your robot answers won't be too long, you could easily stuff hundreds of "memories". The problem is it slows the conversation down a bit as it processes all of that.

@camdez I stuff all of these into the prompt as System-level messages in the format "You remember something important: {memory}" - so to the robot those all appear as system messages that precede the user message.
@wongmjane chat mode in the playground doesn't have a limit, I don't think (been running it all day) https://t.co/JUMX4506oM
actually what might be cool is to have him run through all of his memories every night and assign a weight to them so he remembers important things and forgets unimportant things
now I'm like "it would actually be kind of useful to serve him up old memories at random so he doesn't forget" and a lifetime of anxiety snaps into perspective

sometimes you're writing code, playing god, and you're like "yeah I'll just have him remember the last 20 or so messages, anything older than that, who cares" because it's like one line of code, and then you reflect on a lifetime of things you can't remember- wonder why

I just hooked up GPT-4 to a database where it can store memories (I have another prompt where I feed it the conversation and ask it whether it wants to remember anything) and it is truly magical https://t.co/c2ZH6NaU0S
if anyone needs me I'll be running shell scripts from curl I copy-pasted from the robot without checking https://t.co/00Q1aTEGqb
